word: Sanctified by the Spirit. A great hindrance to the advancement of the work has been brought by church members who, though knowing the truth, have not been sanctified by the truth. It is through sanctification of the truth that we are enabled to appreciate the teachings of Christ, given to guide men and women in all the conduct of life.--Letter 272, 1903, p. 1. (To "My Dear Brethren and Sisters Gathered in Council at Nashville," December 20, 1903.)
